EF Render Bundle

## Attributes Most markdown elements can be modified with attributes ``` markdown Some_inline_markdown {.important} ``` Will include assign 'important' to the class list of the element rendered by 'Some_inline_markdown', e.g. ``` markdown ## Some Heading {.addendum} ``` will produce the html ``` html

Some Heading

``` ## Headings ``` ## Level 2 Heading There should be a single blank line after a heading, before paragraph content. ### Level 3 Heading There should only be a single level 1 heading on a page, and the page title is taking that role, so content headings should start at level 2 #### Level 4 Heading A paragraph under a level 4 headings. ``` ::: example ## Level 2 Heading There should be a single blank line after a heading, before paragraph content. ### Level 3 Heading There should only be a single level 1 heading on a page, and the page title is taking that role, so content headings should start at level 2 #### Level 4 Heading A paragraph under a level 4 headings. ::: ## Code, Key Presses, Variables, oh my Use back ticks (`\``) to enclose inline code. ``` markdown Use the `SUM` function to add up a range of values. ``` ::: example Use the `SUM` function to ::: Use `[[...]]` to denote key presses or button clicks, e.g. ``` markdown Press [[Ctrl]]+[[V]] to paste. Press the [[=]]{.calculator} button on your calculator. ``` ::: example Press [[Ctrl]]+[[V]] to paste. Press the [[=]]{.calculator} button on your calculator. ::: Use `[(...)]` to denote variables. Variables include math variables in equations, excel cell references, or variables in a computer program. ``` markdown {.nohljsln} In the equation above, [(y)] is the height of the projectile. Enter a formula into cell [(B1)]{.excel}. Assign your result to [(theResult)] ``` ::: example In the equation above, [(y)] is the height of the projectile. Enter a formula into cell [(B1)]{.excel}. Assign your result to [(theResult)] ::: ## Super and Subscript C~2~ E=MC^2^
## Unordered lists ``` - unordered list items start with - and a space - items are not numbered ``` ::: example - unordered list items start with - and a space - items are not numbered ::: ## Ordered lists ``` 1. a list item 1. a second list item. - Note that ordered lists do not have sequential numbers, just numbers. - Keeping them all 1 in the markdown makes for easier reordering. - nested content, including nested lists, should be indented to the the start of the parent list item text. ``` ::: example 1. a list item 1. a second list item. - Note that ordered lists do not have sequential numbers, just numbers. - Keeping them all 1 in the markdown makes for easier reordering. - nested content, including nested lists, should be indented to the the start of the parent list item text. ::: ## Definition Lists ``` markdown some term : a very important concept definition another term : another very important concept definition ``` ::: example some term : a very important concept definition another term : another very important concept definition ::: ## Task Lists ``` markdown - [x] Item 1 - [ ] Item 2 - [x] Item 3 ``` ::: example - [x] Item 1 - [ ] Item 2 - [x] Item 3 :::
### Notices Markdown: ``` markdown ! This is an info notice. ! Notices can have multiple lines and contain *markdown* markup. ``` Output: ! This is an info notice. ! Notices can have multiple lines and contain *markdown* markup. Markdown: ``` markdown !! This is a warning notice !! Make sure nothing weird happens for multi-line notices with double. !! And that an exclamation point can appear as expected at the end of a sentence! ``` Output: !! This is a warning notice !! Make sure nothing weird happens for multi-line notices with double. !! And that an exclamation point can appear as expected at the end of a sentence! Markdown: ``` markdown !!! This is an urgent notice ``` ::: box Output: {.output} !!! This is an urgent notice ::: Markdown:
## Content Chunks ### Aside ``` markdown ::: aside Aside for Side Content Some side-content that is related to the main content. ::: ``` ::: aside Aside for Side Content Some side-content that is related to the main content. ::: ``` {.nohljsln} > Here is a blockquote. > Block quotes can have attribution. > -- Some Author ``` > Here is a blockquote. > Block quotes can have attribution. > -- Some Author !! It is a known issue that blockquote markdown currently do not work. For the time being, use html: ```
Here is a blockquote. -- Some Author
``` ::: example
Here is a blockquote. -- Some Author
::: ### Code and Sample Output Here is a code block 

                ``` matlab
                values = randi(10,1,5);
                for idx = 1:length(values)
                    value = values(idx);
                end
                ```
Example: ``` matlab values = randi(10,1,5); for idx = 1:length(values) value = values(idx); end ```

``` If instead of computer code you need to display sample output from a program, use the `~~~` sequence as fences: ``` markdown {.nohljsln} ~~~ env-matlab >> 23; ans = 23 ~~~ ``` ~~~ env-matlab >> 23; ans = 23 ~~~ ## Containers Containers a type of fenced block, similar to fenced code blocks using `:::` as the fence delimiter. ``` ::: box Box with a Title and Attributes {.special} Content in a container will be parsed for *markdown*. ::: ``` ::: box Box with a Title and Attributes {.special} Content in a container will be parsed for *markdown*. The background comes from the stylesheet: ``` matlab {.nohljsln} .card.special { background: #f1Aa43; } ``` ::: ``` ::: box {.special} Containers do not need to have a title. ::: ``` ::: box {.special} Containers do not need to have a title. ::: ### Convenience Containers ``` ::: example Example 1 The example container is a shorthand for `box [title] {.example}` ::: ``` ::: example Example 1 The example container is a shorthand for `box [title] {.example}` :::
``` markdown Inline equations can be actually inline like this $E=mc^s$, or on their own line x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a} ``` Inline equations can be actually inline like this: $E=mc^2$, or on their own line $x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}$ Here is another inline $c^2=a^2+b^2-2ab \cos{C}$. Block equations will display centered on a new line. ``` $$ \begin{aligned} F_{x} &= P\sin\theta - B\\\\ F_{y} &= P\cos\theta - W \end{aligned} $$ ``` $$ \begin{aligned} F_{x} &= P\sin\theta - B\\ F_{y} &= P\cos\theta - W \end{aligned} $$ Theoretically, escaping the delimiters with a slash should prevent them from being typeset as math, for example spreadsheet cell [(\$C\$5)].
## Tables ### Markdown Syntax #### Headerless ``` |----------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------| | ${s_2} = s_1 + {v}_{avg}\cdot \Delta t$ | Average Velocity Equation | | $s_2 = s_1 + \left( \frac{v^2_2 - v^2_1}{2{a}} \right)$ | "No Time Available" Equation | {.eftable} ``` |----------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------| | ${s_2} = s_1 + {v}_{avg}\cdot \Delta t$ | Average Velocity Equation | | $s_2 = s_1 + \left( \frac{v^2_2 - v^2_1}{2{a}} \right)$ | "No Time Available" Equation | {.eftable} #### With Headers Include column names for a header row: ``` | `Column 1` | *Column 2* | |:-----------|------------| | a | b | | c | __d__ | ``` | `Column 1` | *Column 2* | |:-----------|------------| | a | b | | c | __d__ | ### Or HTML HTML can be included, but add the `markdown="1"` attribute if there is markdown that should be parsed in the table contents ``` html
${s_2} = {s_1} + {v}_{avg}\cdot \Delta t$ Average Velocity Equation
${v_2}={v_1}+{a}\cdot \Delta t$ Acceleration Equation
```
${s_2} = {s_1} + {v}_{avg}\cdot \Delta t$ Average Velocity Equation
${v_2}={v_1}+{a}\cdot \Delta t$ Acceleration Equation
!!! Unfortunately, the current bolt rendering system does not support actually embedding content, so it is not feasible to implement markdown syntax for these features at this time. Use the existing php functions and iframe hacks. ## Pages ``` html ``` Be sure to include the `embed` parameter in the query string of the url.
